shared_diagnostic_path.reasoning_pattern: Premature + respiratory distress → CXR pattern → surfactant deficiency vs other

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the newborn presenting with respiratory distress.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Newborn, born after the 32nd gestational week
Patient_Actor.History: The baby was born via cesarean delivery. The mother had gestational diabetes but was otherwise healthy with no other pregnancy-related diseases.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: The mother had gestational diabetes. No other significant family or prenatal history.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: The cyanosis improves with oxygen administration. No feeding difficulties were noted prior to onset of symptoms.

Vital_Signs.Oxygen_Saturation: 88% on room air, improving with oxygen

Respiratory_Examination.Inspection: Cyanosis noted, especially around the lips. Subcostal and intercostal retractions present.
Respiratory_Examination.Auscultation: Reduced breath sounds, no distinct wheezes or crackles initially noted.

Chest_X-Ray.Findings: Ground-glass appearance, air bronchograms, suggesting Respiratory Distress Syndrome (RDS)

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a newborn presenting with respiratory distress and diagnose appropriately.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Newborn, born at 33 weeks of gestation
Patient_Actor.History: The newborn is presenting with respiratory distress 2 hours after birth. The mother had an uneventful pregnancy until premature onset of labor. There was no significant prenatal care history mentioned.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Premature birth at 33 weeks of gestation.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: The newborn is showing signs of respiratory distress including increased respiratory rate, grunting, and retractions. No other system review was mentioned due to the age of the patient.

Respiratory_Examination.Inspection: Subcostal and intercoastal retractions, peripheral cyanosis
Respiratory_Examination.Auscultation: Decreased breath sounds, with fine crackles

Chest_Radiograph.Findings: Fine reticular granulation with ground glass appearance on both lungs
